list.title: Studying computational thinking through collaborative design activities with Scratch
list.otherText: Poster to be presented at the 13th International Conference on Computer Supported Collaborative Learning (CSCL), June 2019. Lyon, France: International Society of the Learning Sciences.

list.title: Utilizing the consensual assessment technique to compare creativity in drama spaces
Connected cosplay: Fan work as pathways toward opportunity
list.otherText: In J. Kay & R. Luckin (Eds.), Rethinking learning in the digital age: Making the Learning Sciences count: The International Conference of the Learning Sciences (ICLS) 2018 (Vol. 3, pg. 1605-1606). London, UK: International Society of the Learning Sciences. ISBN: 978-1-7324672-2-4

team.name: Dr. Kylie A. Peppler
team.title: Lab Director
team.intro: Kylie is an Associate Professor in Informatics and Education at University of California, Irvine and Director of the Creativity Labs. An artist by training, she engages in research that focuses on the intersection of arts, media, new technologies, and informal learning.

team.name: Janis Watson
team.title: Curriculum Specialist
team.intro: Janis is a 20-year veteran schoolteacher, an education writer, and a curriculum designer. Her interests lie in designing and facilitating the creation of innovative online, digital, and game-based learning experiences.

team.name: Shenshen Han
team.title: System Developer
team.intro: Shenshen is currently working as system/software specialist at Creativity Labs. His recent interest mainly lies on exploring the sense of the next generation Internet Computing. He is an enthusiast of computer networks and pervasive computing.

team.name: Anna Keune
team.title: Graduate Research Assistant
team.intro: Anna is a doctoral candidate in the Learning Sciences program at Indiana University. As a new media artist and designer, she leverages her international experiences across four continents to engage in research that spans across art, technology design, and materiality of learning.

team.name: Joey Huang
team.title: Graduate Research Assistant
team.intro: Joey is a Ph.D. candidate in Learning Sciences. Coming from educational psychology and computing, her research focuses on computational thinking, collaboration, and STEM learning, hoping to create more interesting and inspiring learning environments to promote equity and collaboration.

team.name: Naomi Thompson
team.title: Graduate Research Assistant
team.intro: Coming from psychology, education, and arts, Naomi is interested in intersections of arts, making, and broadening STEM participation. She is currently working on systems thinking through play in BioSim, and is involved in the ReCrafting Math project.
